intro: Nasturtiopsis, commonly known as the watercress buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of dark green, glossy leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to wetlands and moist environments in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its leaves are edible and have a peppery, tangy flavor similar to watercress. Nasturtiopsis is often found in shallow water or along the edges of streams and ponds.
